instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shows logo, nothing happens
threads.message:
I tried all the resets, won't do safe mode. Will only show the logo and then nothing.
Was water damage around the LVDS on backlight pins only, really light. No backlight, but with new LCD assembly is backlight. Don't see any other liquid anywhere. Ultrasoniced anyways.
I've checked the drive is good.
Does this mean bad memory?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shows logo, nothing happens
threads.message: Will run in SMC bypass, but won't do ASD. So SMC issue then I assume?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shows logo, nothing happens
threads.message: Nevermind.  I think it was getting too hot. I put on some Arctic Silver and the cooling fins and boots normally. However it still will not run ASD. Why not?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shows logo, nothing happens
threads.message:
OK, give me the dumb-ass award. ASD doesn't run without wifi card installed.
All answers answered. Close this out.  How do we delete Louis? There needs to be a delete button, or else this looks like my fucking diary.
